title: PostgreSQL Database Administrator
description:
Qualified candidates are being considered for openings within the Database Operations group. Candidates should possess a strong background in SQL Server, MySQL and PostgreSQL database management and administration. The individual will partner with product support, and DevOps CSM to keep databases secured, healthy and up to date to meet SLAs. The position is part of the Database Operations group which focuses on managing, maintaining, and securing databases in the AWS Cloud. This position requires an extensive experience with PostgreSQL, MSSQL, MySQL, and experience with AWS Cloud services.
 



  





**\*\*This is a remote position\*\*** 




  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Install, upgrade, and manage database servers and schemas.
* Set and maintain enterprise database standards.
* Manage database access and develop processes for optimizing database security.
* Performance tuning of database systems particularly RDS/Aurora PostgreSQL and MySQL.
* Create database backups and restore database from backups.
* Plan capacity for database servers, diagnose and troubleshoot database errors.
* Create and manage database reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
* Write complex PL/SQL, understand complex queries, able to tune complex queries.
* Automate repeating database tasks and be available for on-call support.
* Experience as a DBA with AWS Cloud databases MSSQL, Aurora/RDS PostgreSQL and MySQL.
* Monitor database incidents queue and act based on priority.
* Implement and deploy database changes in Prod and QA environments.
* Monitor MSSQL, MySQL, and PostgreSQL database performance issues and resolve them.
* Interact with other DBA team members, product support team, and DevOps CSM and keep them aware of critical issues at hand.
* Manage, maintain, and secure RDS Aurora PostgreSQL, MySQL and MSSQL databases.
* Understand the PL SQL scripts provided in the change and be able to make a call if scripts are not well performant or not correct.
* Troubleshoot and resolve SSRS issues.
* Proactive and take ownership of highly visible issues and projects. Establish partnership with other teams and drive projects.
* Establish database support standards to help in the areas of database support with minimal interruptions.
* Able to provide database level technical leadership and mentor junior DBAs.



  





**Job Requirements** 



* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field and 12+ years of IT industry experience.
* 10+ experience in database administration roles in MSSQL, MySQL and Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL.
* Experience with Linux and Windows Server environments.
* Extensive experience with database technologies (MySQL, MSSQL, PostgreSQL).
* Experience with AWS cloud services.
* Solid understanding of RDS cluster, taking snapshot of RDS instance, monitor database. performance issues and resolve them, and participate in On-Call rotation as needed.
* Experience with cloud database infrastructure management and administration.
* Extensive experience in HA/DR in major enterprise database systems.
* Experience in SQL Server Reporting Services.
* Good verbal communication and writing skills.
* Preferred AWS certified professional who has experience in RDS, IAM, EC2, VPC and Storage.
* Experience in troubleshooting performance issues from infrastructure and database engine.
* Experience working with clients and other department leads within the organization.
* Expert in writing PL/SQL and PostgreSQL performance tuning and optimization.



  





**Competencies:** 




 Action Oriented, Customer Focus, Technical Skills, Problem Solving, Personal Learning, Experience in either the Banking or Financial Industry is preferred.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Position:** 




 Senior Data Engineer
 



 Hybrid Role
 



  





**ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES** 




 1. Work closely with the Enterprise Data Engineering team to design and construct data architectures, databases, and processing systems that support big data transformation and structuring.
 



 2. Leverage deep understanding of SQL, data warehousing, ETL processes, and Python to develop large scale data structures and pipelines.
 



 3. Create and manage data pipelines using Azure Data Factory (ADF) and implement data notebooks for data transformation and structuring.
 



 4. Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
 



 5. Collaborate with data scientists, data architects, project leaders to achieve project goals.
 



 6. Ensure data solutions are compliant with privacy and security standards.
 



  





**QUALIFICATIONS** 




 1. 7-8 years of experience in the Data Warehouse, building ETL.
 



 2. Extensive experience working with SQL and Python.
 



 3. Proven experience with Azure cloud tools like ADF, Synapse Notebooks, Azure Databricks and Data Lake.
 



 4. Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
 



 5. Strong project management and organizational skills.
 



  





**PREFERRED SKILLS** 




 The successful candidate will have a proven track record in data engineering and demonstrate proficiency in SQL, Python, and azure cloud tools like ADF, Synapse Analytics and Databricks.

title: Senior Backend Web Developer
description:
At Tafi and DAZ 3D, we build tools and help humans and brands express themselves through stylized and uber-creative assets for the digital world.
 



 As a leader in 3D technology since 2000, Daz 3D empowers 3D artists and designers with a free, comprehensive software suite and a massive 3D marketplace with over 5 million inter-compatible assets for Daz Studio and other 3D applications. We offer hobbyists and professionals the tools they need to create high-quality 3D renders and animations featuring customizable content that can be exported anywhere.
 



 Tafi operates Daz 3D, a leading content creation platform, serving millions of professional and recreational artists worldwide. Its catalog includes more than five million 3D assets, many of which are high-resolution and interoperable, and exportable to other leading software programs. The company has partnered with iconic brands such as Coca-Cola, Warner Brothers, Champion, Estee Lauder, Timex, RTFKT (now Nike), Coinbase, and others for web3 and NFT activations.
 



  





 Senior Web Backend Developer
 



 Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, or US Remote
 



 Position Type: Full-Time
 



 Reports to: Chief Product Officer
 



 As a Senior Web Backend Developer, you will lead the development of Tafi and Daz 3D's web backend systems, ensuring the successful execution of backend initiatives, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, and driving innovation in our backend development processes.
 



 Your Impact as a Senior Web Backend Developer
 


* Lead the development and implementation of scalable and robust web backend solutions.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
* Design and optimize databases for performance and scalability.
* Integrate third-party services and APIs.
* Troubleshoot and debug applications to ensure optimal performance.
* Innovate by modernizing and scaling backend activities in the organization.
* Stay informed of emerging web backend technologies and integrate improvements into our backend systems.
* Collaborate with front-end developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to ensure backend solutions meet product requirements and quality standards.
* Identify, escalate, and mitigate risks to the business emerging from backend engineering initiatives.



 You Bring to Daz 3D and Tafi:
 


* 5+ years of experience in web backend development or application delivery.
* Proven ability to oversee the web backend development process from concept to deployment of complex applications.
* Strong understanding of backend development technologies such as App Engine, Golang
* Experience with database management systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Datastore, or similar.
* Strong understanding of Agile development methodologies.
* Effective communication skills and the ability to share knowledge with diverse stakeholders.



 Bonus Skills and Abilities
 


* Degree in computer science, software engineering, or related discipline.
* Certifications in: CSPO, CSM, ITIL, PMP.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automated testing.
* Understanding of security best practices and secure coding principles.
* Experience with microservices architecture.



 Working Conditions:
 


* Regular hours, with occasional overtime and flexibility required to meet project deadlines
* May require sitting or standing for extended periods
* Occasional travel may be required for company events or meetings



 What do Daz and Tafi Have to Offer?
 



  




* Competitive salary
* Health, dental, and vision insurance with most or all of the premiums paid by the company
* 401k matching plan
* Unlimited paid vacation potential
* Paid monthly gym membership at VASA or reimbursement to a gym of your choice



 Do I need ALL Criteria to Apply To Daz 3D and Tafi?
 



 Absolutely not! Studies have shown that women, people of color, and other underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are drawn to this role and your past experiences do not align perfectly with the job description, but you think you have something we should be looking for, please apply, and let’s see where the conversation goes!
 



 We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
 



 Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
 



 We strive to create and maintain an environment where all our employees feel included and empowered to work in a safe environment. We celebrate and value each employee’s unique experiences and perspectives across our company and recognize that fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive place to work ensures a vibrant and joyful place for creativity to be explored.

title: System Developer, Engineer
description:
**POSITION:** 
         System Developer, Engineer 
   

**REPORTS TO:** 
     Manager, IT Development
   

**DEPARTMENT:** 
   Information Technology Services (ITS)
   

**LOCATION:** 
         North Bay
   

**REFERENCE:** 
       800-69C-25
   

**SALARY:** 
              $80,730 - $94,990
   

  

**WHO WE ARE:** 
  

 Ontario Northland Transportation Commission (ONTC) is an Agency of the Province of Ontario that provides efficient and vital transportation services.  We employ over 900 skilled professionals and are over 120 years old and proud of our heritage and connection to the communities we serve.  We are focused on moving forward with the goal of being a valued leader in transportation.  We offer competitive salary, excellent benefits, a defined benefit pension plan, paid vacation, 3 paid personal leave days along with discounted transportation on our bus and passenger rail services.
   

  

**ACCOUNTABILITY STATEMENT:** 
  

 The System Developer, Enterprise Systems’ role is to monitor, maintain and support the organization’s core business systems through implementation best practices and supported procedures. Duties focus on working with enterprise applications that the organization uses for business operations. This role is also responsible for planning, coordinating, and implementing the change management of processes required for the support of assigned systems necessary for business operations.
   

  

**MAJOR DUTIES/ RESPONSIBILITIES:** 
* Ensure that enterprise applications meet business requirements and goals, fulfills user requirements, and identifies and resolves systems issues
* Participate in the systems change management process to support enterprise systems
* Defines methodologies for the design, development, and implementation of applications
* Develops and implements application optimization for business process requirements
* Develops plans for system improvements for management approval and implements approved changes
* Recommend any additional hardware or software requirements needed for successful system deployments, improvements, configuration, or maintenance
* Coordinate and assist with contract negotiations for related support, services, and subscriptions
* Liaise with vendors and support providers for prompt rectification of any problems or emergencies
* Evaluate incidents and issues in order to identify potential problem areas and make the appropriate recommendations
* Assist in long term (multi-year) budgeting and forecasting to support the enterprise systems both operational and capital
* Serves as a systems administrator and technical SME for Ontario Northland enterprise applications
* Evaluate, install, configure, and deploy enterprise applications, systems software, products, and/or enhancements to existing applications throughout the enterprise
* Collaborate with internal and 3rd party analysts, designers, and system owners in the testing of software programs and applications
* Ensure that any integration into systems meets functional requirements, system compliance, and interface specifications
* Perform daily monitoring and troubleshooting of the systems including performance management; install and configure patches and upgrades as required
* Manage and maintain user access control and permissions.  Establish appropriate access, permissions, and menus for system users
* Prepare and deliver activity and progress reports on systems health
* Provide tier 3 support on assigned enterprise applications
* Provide recommendations on systems improvement and enhancements
* Develop reports for end users using standard reporting tools and makes reports available to appropriate users
* Assists with end user training and develops support documentation
* Other duties as assigned by the Manager, IT Development


  

**REQUIREMENTS:** 
* College or university graduate in a business or technology field, or equivalent experience/certification
* 5+ years of direct experience administering enterprise-level applications and integrated business systems (EAM, ERP, MRP, HRIS, timekeeping, EGIS etc.)

title: Database Engineer Intern - Specialists in Handling Vast Datasets of Voice and Ensuring Efficient Ope
description:
**Company Overview:** 
  

  

 At Vosyn, we embrace the exciting, game-changing world of Artificial Intelligence, driving innovation and pioneering impactful projects across various industries. Our incubator, AI Venture Lab is nestled in the heart of Office146.com, is a crucible of entrepreneurial spirit, supported by intelligent processes and industry-leading best practices. We believe in fostering a culture of flexibility, continuous improvement, and solution-focused strategies. Here, every idea is welcomed, nurtured, and has the potential to scale to new heights. Currently, we're at the forefront of a significant IPO endeavor, truly a unicorn in the making. We invite you to be part of our journey and leave your imprint on the future of AI.
 







**About the job:** 
  

  

 We are currently seeking AI Database Interns for a challenging experience based Internship to contribute to an innovative and groundbreaking project in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Are you passionate about AI and looking to make your mark in the industry? Come join our dynamic team as we push the boundaries and create a game changer in the world of AI. You will have the unique opportunity to participate in a fully immersive internship where you will be managing vast datasets of voice and driving efficient data pipelining and ETL practices. This is designed largely as a remote placement however can also be a hybrid internship (Chicago or Toronto). In this engagement/applied learning internship you'll gain unparalleled experience in a high-growth, dynamic environment, directly interfacing with senior management and largely different from any other internship. It will be a demanding internship and will require you to bring the best version of yourself to the table, but for those who embrace this, it will be a richly rewarding experience as well as a great compliment to your academic investment.
   

  

**What You'll Do:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient database solutions.
* Optimize database systems for performance and reliability.
* Implement, maintain, and test database backup and recovery strategies.
* Collaborate with other team members to improve the existing database infrastructure.
* Provide support for database issues and performance tuning.
* Ensure data integrity and security in database systems.
* Contribute to the documentation of best practices and technological choices







**About You:** 



* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Database Engineer or in a similar role.
* Experience in AWS.
* Strong knowledge of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL), database design, and SQL scripting.
* Experience in optimizing database performance and capacity.
* Familiarity with database security, backup, and recovery procedures.
* Excellent problem-solving capabilities and analytical skills.
* Solid written and verbal communication skills.
* Eagerness to innovate and challenge the conventional in the field of databases.
* Experience using Notion.







 At Vosyn, you will have the opportunity to engage with a fast growing global organization with diversity of thought, experience and cultures. Our interns have come from some of the top universities all around the world and we invite you to join us on this exciting journey.
 







**Additional Perks:** 



* Be part of the invigorating journey of a start-up transitioning to an IPO.
* Engage directly with senior management and strategic advisory board members.
* Enhance your CV with a rich array of experiences unique to Vosyn and AI Venture Lab.
* Get priority consideration for future full-time roles post-internship placement.
* Gain valuable experience with shaping and developing all facets of a world class software engineering department, while embracing the experiential learning' that comes from work in a fast paced global company.







 This is a full-time, paid internship with a minimum commitment of 3 months (520 hours). We do have some flexibility with possible Part-time placements providing it is to accommodate for academic responsibilities or visa restrictions but the total hours required remains the same. With flexibility comes increased responsibility to this and will require a higher concentrated effort in order to be current with projects, align with your team and to extract the value this internship is engineered to award. The compensation will be $32-$35 per hour, commensurate with experience and qualifications.
 







**DEI and Workplace Safety:** 








 At Vosyn Inc., we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where every employee feels valued and supported. We believe that diversity of thought, background, and experience enriches our company culture and enhances innovation. We are an equal-opportunity employer and encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. As part of our commitment to creating a safe and healthy work environment, we prioritize workplace safety, adhering to all relevant regulations and promoting a culture of responsibility. We believe that a safe and inclusive workplace is essential for the well-being and success of our team members. Join us in building a workplace that values diversity, prioritizes equity, and ensures the safety and well-being of every individual.
 







**Application Method** 




 Please apply via our career site: https://vosyn.ai/careers/

title: Oracle Database PL/SQL Developer
description:

 Are you tired of managing databases and operational issues and want to focus more on solving problems and adding value through product development? This position allows you to leverage all of your Oracle expertise to produce complex, highly optimized PL/SQL programs.
 

 The ideal candidate would have a passion for developing great software in a highly collaborative agile team environment with a hunger to continuously learn, grow, and improve.

	+ Web services and working with JSON and XML data payloads.

* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

title: Findur Developer
Senior Data Engineer
description:
At OpsGuru, we're a people-first, customer-obsessed company motivated by our passion for empowering organizations of all sizes to embrace the power of Cloud technology through impactful, reliable and scalable consultancy services.
 



 Our team is made up of technical experts, creatives, salespeople, and many more. We work together to drive our mission forward and raise the bar for our customers daily, bringing their vision to life. We strive to be a workplace of inspired minds by fostering an environment that encourages innovative thinking, where everyone can grow and contribute to achieving their goals.
 



  





 Our long-term vision is to continue being an innovative and inspiring company that our customers and employees admire, and we invite you to join us!
 



  





**About the role:** 




  





 As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the OpsGuru professional services team architecting, designing, automating, and deploying production-grade data services and flows on behalf of our customers to a variety of public clouds such as AWS, Google Cloud and Azure.
 



  





**What you'll be doing:** 




  




* Building and optimizing ETL/ELT processes for efficiency and reliability, employing modern tools such as Dbt, Glue, and custom scripts in Python, Scala, or Java.
* Building robust data pipelines that integrate data science and machine learning models, leveraging Spark, Airflow, and MLflow.
* Implementing and maintaining scalable data storage and computation solutions, including Data Lakes, Data Warehouses, and NoSQL databases, to support advanced analytics and AI-driven applications.
* Developing and maintaining real-time data processing and analytics platforms using Kafka, Spark Streaming, Kinesis, Pub Sub, and other streaming technologies to enable instant insights and decision-making.
* Establishing credibility and build impactful relationships with our customers



  





**Your skills & experience:** 




  




* 5+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering, with a proven track record of designing and implementing large-scale data processing and analytics systems.
* 2+ years of experience working with AI/ML models in production environments, including experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and model deployment and monitoring tools.
* 3+ years’ of experience in production database architectures (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle) and data pipeline development
* Demonstrated knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
* Deep understanding of data modeling, data architecture, and data storage strategies for both structured and unstructured data.
* Strong foundation in distributed systems and big data technologies, with extensive experience in at least a few of the following: Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, Airflow, MLflow, Cassandra, ElasticSearch.
* Expertise in cloud platforms and services for data and ML workloads (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure), including managed services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML) and serverless computing.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and strong communication skills, capable of effectively articulating complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, with additional certifications or coursework in data science and machine learning highly regarded.
* Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly



  





**What's in it for you:** 




  





 Compensation & Perks
 


* Competitive compensation package as a contractor



  





 Flexibility
 


* Remote first work environment
* Flexible work hours & location



  





 At OpsGuru, we encourage employees to bring their whole, authentic selves to work. By sharing and embracing unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives, we learn from each other, innovate, and create a dynamic environment where we can be and achieve our best.
 



 We're dedicated to ensuring each member feels a sense of belonging, safety, and respect. At OpsGuru, your unique voice is heard and embraced, and you meaningfully contribute to decision-making and the organization's growth.
 



  





 OpsGuru is committed to an equitable employee experience, opportunity, and support. If you require accommodations or support during the recruitment process, please email us at hr@opsguru.io.

title: Mainframe Developer
description:
**Job Title: Mainframe Developer** 




  





 Location: Richmond Hill, ON
 



  





**Company Overview:** 




 This company is committed to diversity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates, especially aboriginal persons, members of sexual minority groups, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and women. Upon request by the applicant, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. We thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 



 They are seeking a skilled Mainframe Developer to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will have significant experience with mainframe systems and be proficient in COBOL, DB2, SAS, SQL, and JCL. This role involves developing, maintaining, and optimizing mainframe applications to support our critical business operations. The ideal candidate will also possess strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 








* Proven track record of managing mainframe databases and developing mainframe applications.
* Ability to understand and implement business requirements into technical solutions.
* Significant experience on mainframe systems utilizing COBOL, DB2, SAS, SQL and JCL is critical
* Developing, maintaining, and optimizing mainframe applications to support our critical business operations
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



  





  





**Desired Skills:** 




  




* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Database Experience: DB2, IMS, VSAM
* Platform Experience: Cloud, VMC 2.0, UNIX
* Platform Experience: MVS
* Experience with developer tools such as Endevor, TSO, CA7 Scheduling, and Service Now.
* Knowledge of file transfer protocols and tools like EBX and TIBCO mailboxes
* Netron CAP, JAVA, Angular, Powerbuilder
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze and resolve complex technical issues
* Certifications in relevant mainframe technologies are a plus



  





  





  





**What's great in the job?** 




  




* A culture emphasizing consistent high performance, marked by a notable success rate in projects and significant year-over-year revenue growth.
* Opportunities for a growth mindset, including participation in certification programs, mentorship, talent investment initiatives, internal mobility options, and internship opportunities.
* Contributing to global impact by collaborating on impactful projects for esteemed global clients, actively shaping the future of the industry.
* An inclusive and welcoming multicultural environment that promotes openness, communication, and regular team-building events.
* Committed to social sustainability values, including initiatives focused on IT education, community empowerment, fair operating practices, environmental sustainability, and gender equality.



  





  





**What We Offer** 




  




* Each employee has a chance to see the impact of his work. You can make a real contribution to the success of the company.
* Embrace adaptability and flexibility, recognizing that a dynamic and evolving workplace is key to staying competitive and responsive to change.
* Recognize and celebrate achievements, milestones, and exceptional contributions to create a positive and motivating work environment.
* Are you interested in enriching your work experience? We need people like you, passionate and committed. If you want to join our team, please apply to this job posting.

title: Sr. Developer
description:
**Pharma Medica Research (PMRI) Inc.** 
 is a Contract Research Organization that strives for innovation and original solutions in a highly regulated and competitive industry. If your career goals align with innovation and original thinking you will be the perfect candidate to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization. Our reputation for delivering high quality research is outstanding. At PMRI we are committed to making a difference in healthcare and people’s lives. Come join our team!
 



  





 We are currently looking for a
 ***Sr. Developer***
 to join our team!
 



  





 The Sr. Developer to be responsible for implementing and developing new and/or existing applications while respecting the standard operating procedures at Pharma Medica Research Inc. (PMRI). The Sr. Developer position reports to Director, Software Development and/or designate.
 



  





**Duties and Responsibilities:** 



* Develop, implement, and maintain secure intranet or Client/Server interfaces applications for use by PMRI employees.
* Work with computer Services staff to develop and maintain a dynamic and extensible application which is consistent in design, high quality, and high performance.
* Continue the development for Web, stand alone or Client/Server application using .NET technology, and other emerging technologies.
* Revise and optimize existing code to improve its structure, readability, and performance, while ensuring that the functionality remains consistent and reliable.
* Maintain and support on-going development projects.
* Perform all phases of SDLC, starting with Requirement Analysis, Planning, Architectural design, Development, Testing, and Deployment.
* Plan, communicate, and execute development sprints.
* Support and troubleshoot all technical issues affecting operations.
* Identify and prioritize issues and bug reports, including communicating with end users to gather necessary information.
* Participate in network design, security, and configuration.
* Manage all aspects of Database Administration, Physical and Logical Database Design.
* Documentation, Maintenance, Optimization, and Backups.
* Involvement in Data Warehousing and Data Replication Projects.
* Analyze companywide business requirements and write reports in SQL, PL/SQL, and SQL Report Writer Requirement.
* Other duties as required.



  





**Requirements** 



* Degree in Information Technology or related field.
* Six years’ experience in software development.
* Knowledge of OOP, C#, and .NET.
* Familiarity with technologies such as Blazor, MSSQL, and IIS.
* Full understanding of SDLC, OOAD, and experience working in an agile development environment.
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills .
* Ability to work closely with all departments and personnel to ensure all computer technology needs and requirements are achieved.



  





 At Pharma Medica, we have a competitive package including:
 


* Competitive compensation plan
* A benefit plan that is fully paid for by PMRI, including healthcare, dentalcare, vision care, LTD, Life Insurance, AD&D, along with a Health Spending and Wellness Spending Accounts and a voluntary RRSP Contribution Plan
* Opportunities for advancement and career progression
* A generous Employee Milestones Awards Program
* Corporate Discounts Program
* Learning Support Programs
* Friendly atmosphere, culture of learning



  





 Please note all applications must be eligible to work within Canada.
 



 PMRI is an Equal Opportunity Employer; promoting accessibility and inclusivity at work and offering accommodation for applicants as required and requested.
 



 We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected to proceed in the interview process will be contacted.
